result.execSummary:
The defendant Hugo A Montague was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge due in 60 days.

records.addlTxt: Dr. concludes that defendat is competent to proceed. Defn. does not with to challenge report.  State does not object to conclusions of report.  Ct. Finds defendant is competent.  Commitment for treatment to competency is terminated.
Discharge Order.  The Order of Commitment is discharged.
Competency hearing at 11-10-2015 10:00 am
Karyn L Gust-Brey, Ph.D.
of Commitment for Treatment

Reporter: Heather Kieta
Testimony and exhibit; Exhibit 1 marked, identified as report of Dr. Smith and received into evidence; argument of counsel; Court found Defendant was not competent to proceed at this time but that the Defendant could be restored to competency within the statutory time limits and ordered the Defendant committed to be treated to competency

Reporter: Heather Kieta
Court appointed Atty Schulenburg to represent Defendant; Defendant did not object to appointment of Atty Schulenburg; report of Dr. Smith found Defendant not competent at this time but that Defendant could be restored to competency; Defendant contested the findings of Dr. Smith; Atty Sattler advised she was not prepared for a contested hearing and requested a brief adjournment; Court granted request and hearing was rescheduled for 10-08-2015
Atty E. Schulenburg $70

per notice from Dr. Smith defn. refuses to participate in examination.  ADA Sattler requests inpatient evaluation.  Ct. finds defn. refuses to participate in examination and orders defn. into custody and held to have inpatient competency examination.
from Dr. B. Smith indicating that defendant has refused to participate in the examination.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Reporter: Jessica Case
Court adjourned Court Trial; Atty Sattler raised the issue of competency of the Defendant to proceed; Court ordered an outpatient competency evaluation and suspended proceedings

Reporter: Jessica Case
Atty Fallon requested setover of court trial due to witnesses not being subpoenaed; Defendant did not object; Court granted request
Court trial on August 24, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Court Reporter: Philip Harrelson -  Status Conference on 6-18-2015
Court trial on July 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Court Reporter: Philip Harrelson
Defendant appeared without counsel; Atty Sattler advised the State's offer to the Defendant was for dismissal upon completion of the Deferred Prosecution Program and the Defendant rejected that offer; Court had colloquy with Defendant about right to counsel and right to a trial by jury; Defendant advised he was waiving his right to counsel and that he did not want a jury trial; Court found Defendant's waiver of counsel and jury trial to have been made knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily; case will be set for a trial to the Court

Defendant appeared without counsel; Court admonished Defendant about right to counsel and delay of proceedings; Court found Defendant waived his right to counsel; ADA Shimabuku tendered discovery to Defendant in courtroom which Defendant refused to take; case will be set for STC/JS/JT
